speaker: Outstanding Guest Actress in a Comedy Series
text: Jean Smart  * * *  ## Transcript {nicholas hartley}    _Act One.  Scene One - Caf e Nervosa. Frasier is sat when Roz arrives and sits with him. _

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, thank God you're here.
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Guest Actress in a Comedy Series

speaker: Frasier
text: Why, what's wrong, Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: My book club meets tonight and I haven't read the book.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my, that is a literary 911!  Wait, you joined a book club?

speaker: Roz
text: Why is that so hard to believe?  I like to read.

speaker: Frasier
text: What's his name?

speaker: Roz
text: [_giving in:_] Jason.

speaker: Frasier
text: A-ha.

speaker: Roz
text: We met at a book store and he asked me to join his club. He's separated, but I think it's for keeps.  He was buying "Divorce for Dummies."

speaker: Frasier
text: Sounds like a real catch, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Anyway, I was supposed to read "The Great Gatsby" last night but I couldn't get Alice to sleep.  So could you give me a quick summary? [_takes out book and notes:_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all right, er, it was a time known as the Jazz Age. Wall Street was booming, bootleg hooch was flowing and the young people were doing a new dance called the Charleston.

speaker: Roz
text: Where were you when I was trying to get Alice to sleep, could you just get to it already?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right, fine. [_notices a blond woman who has just entered_] Lorna Lenley!

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, who's she?  Gatsby's girlfriend?

speaker: Frasier
text: The woman who just walked in.  She was the great beauty of my high school.  She had brains, looks, style and the way she filled out a mohair sweater - well, suffice it to say it was snugger on her than on the goat!

speaker: Roz
text: Why don't you go over and say hello?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh God, Roz, she wouldn't even remember me.  She was with the in-crowd.  The only people that knew me debated, recited or were on a six-month visit from Abu Dhabi! [_nervous:_] God, she's coming over, she's coming over, she's coming over!

speaker: Lorna
text: [_arrives_] Excuse me, didn't we go to high school together?

speaker: Frasier
text: Did we?

speaker: Lorna
text: Yes, I thought you looked familiar.  You're Frasier, aren't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's right. [_laughs_] All right, let me guess, em, Lisa?

speaker: Lorna
text: Lorna.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, of course.  Hello.  Roz, I'd like you to meet Lorna Ann Lenley. [_Lorna looks surprised_] Anywhere close?

speaker: Lorna
text: Very good!  Although it's Gardner now, but I'm going back to Lenley, I was recently divorced.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh gosh, I'm sorry to hear that.  Er, Roz our chatting isn't bothering your reading is it?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh no, actually I... [_off his glare:_] Oh right, off I go! [_goes to get her coffee_]

speaker: Frasier
text: So, er, I'm divorced myself actually.

speaker: Lorna
text: Yes, I know, I listen to your show.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Lorna
text: Well, I sell Real Estate, so I'm in my car all the time.  So whenever I can, I turn you on.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my. [_laughs_]

speaker: Lorna
text: Excuse me, I'll have to get that.

speaker: Frasier
text: No problemo. [_goes to Roz's table_] Roz, she's just as lovely as ever.

speaker: Roz
text: So, are you going to ask her out?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh right, Legs Lenley and Crane the Brain - in my dreams!

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, you act like you're still some dorky teenager; you're a charming, successful man.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: [_mimicking_] No problemo.

speaker: Lorna
text: [_comes over_] Excuse me, I have to go show a house.  Frasier, it was really nice to see you again.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, likewise.  Er, Lorna, listen, I realise that this is out of the blue and you're very busy but I was wondering if you might like to...

speaker: Lorna
text: Yes?

speaker: Frasier
text: ...appraise my apartment.  You see, I've decided to sell it.

speaker: Lorna
text: Sure, I'd be happy to.  In fact I'm free tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Well, how's seven 'o clock?  I live at the Elliot Bay Towers.

speaker: Lorna
text: Oh, wow!  What a great building!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well.

speaker: Lorna
text: You've certainly done well for yourself.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, I think you'll find we've both come a long way since high school.  You know, here, let me carry those for you. _Frasier takes her books and helps her out of the caf e, smirking to Roz with delight as he follows her like the teenager that he is.  Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. Martin is putting his coat on as Frasier chats to him. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!  She'll be here any minute.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, I'm leaving.

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, I'm sorry to uproot you like this.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it's all right.  I'd rather clear the decks for a date than for one of your theme parties.  Although I am kinda sorry I missed "An Evening With Moe Howard."

speaker: Frasier
text: That was Noel Coward!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, what are you doing here?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I've got a crisis.  Tomorrow's Mel's birthday and I'm planning a very romantic evening but my Gagino is on the fritz.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh jeez, I don't need to hear this!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!  It's a stove!

speaker: Martin
text: I know; six burners and a griddle, don't you guys ever talk about cars? [_exits_]

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I'm desperate, can I possibly use your kitchen tomorrow to prepare the meal?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course, Niles.  But listen, now you've got to go, I have a date.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh!  Anyone I know?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, as a matter of fact, yes: Lorna Lenley.

speaker: Niles
text: Oooh! [_then:_] No, really, who?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's true, I bumped into her today at the Cafe.

speaker: Niles
text: Lorna Lenley?!  You, sir, have moxy!  Why, even with all my vested authority as hall monitor I could never muster the courage to ask to see her bathroom pass.  And you asked her out!  Whoa!  I bow down before you, I doff my cap to you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually it's not really a date.

speaker: Niles
text: I knew it!

speaker: Frasier
text: You see, she's coming over to appraise the apartment.  She's in Real Estate and I tried to ask her out and I choked.  I did get the impression that she was interested in me, though.

speaker: Niles
text: Well of course she is.  Oh and the coach called, you're starting the big game on Sunday.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Niles, off you go. _Niles however wants to stay.  They begin arguing until the doorbell rings._

speaker: Frasier
text: She's here.  You've got one quick "hello" and then you're gone, mister. [_opens door to Lorna_]

speaker: Lorna
text: Hello, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lorna, good to see you again.  Perhaps you remember my brother, Niles.

speaker: Lorna
text: Yes, hello Niles.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, now that you two have had a chance to catch up, I'll see you later.

speaker: Lorna
text: Nice to see you again, Niles.

speaker: Lorna
text: Oh, Frasier, wow!  What a great apartment!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Lorna
text: Why are you selling it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I don't want to bore you with the details, it's a very long, very complicated story.

speaker: Lorna
text: Well, I'd love to hear it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Er, well, I need more closet space.  Could I interest you in some wine?

speaker: Lorna
text: Oh, I would love some. _Lorna takes off her jacket.  She is about to lay it on Martin's chair but she is put off and props it on the couch._

speaker: Lorna
text: Do you remember Chip Clayton's graduation party?  Remember when we broke into his father's liquor cabinet and we made sangria out of a hundred dollar bottle of wine?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs at the memory then:_] No.

speaker: Lorna
text: You know, I should make some notes on your apartment. [_she begins to_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o:_] What are you doing?  Tell her why you really asked her over and drop this ridiculous charade.  You're not sixteen years old any longer.

speaker: Lorna
text: Frasier, I'd love to see your bedroom.

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course. [_v.o:_] Lorna Lenley wants to see my bedroom! _Scene Three - Frasier's Bedroom. Frasier and Lorna enter the bedroom, she is amazed._

speaker: Lorna
text: Oh, Frasier, wow, another great room.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Lorna
text: Is this bed Scandinavian? [_sits on the bed_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You have a good eye. [_v.o:_] Lorna Lenley's on my bed!  Stop acting like an adolescent!

speaker: Lorna
text: Frasier, are you all right?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, actually Lorna, I'm not all right.  You see, when I saw you this afternoon I immediately flashed back to the hopeless crush I had on you in high school.  Of course it didn't help matters much that you've hardly changed a bit and I wanted to ask you out and I lost my nerve.

speaker: Lorna
text: You mean all of this was just a ruse to get me up here?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm afraid so.  So, now that I've sufficiently embarrassed myself, I'll show you out.

speaker: Lorna
text: [_walks to him_] You know, Frasier, I have to say I'm really very flattered.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Lorna
text: Yes.  You know, it's not too late to ask me out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Would you like to have dinner with me this evening?

speaker: Lorna
text: I'd love to.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wonderful. _Frasier walks out of the room calmly with her, however his mind isn't so calm._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_ecstatic v.o:_] I'm going out with Lorna Lenley! **2 GOOD 2 BE 4 GOTTEN** _Scene Four - Frasier's Bedroom. The following morning, Frasier and Lorna awake in each other's arms._

speaker: Lorna
text: Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi.

speaker: Lorna
text: I had a wonderful time last night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Me too.  It's like being back in high school, but with sex.

speaker: Lorna
text: [_laughs and kisses him_] I don't want this to end.

speaker: Frasier
text: I must warn you, now that I've learned to finally ask you out, I'll be doing a lot more of it.  Are you free this evening?  You see, there I go already.  How about tomorrow night?  Somebody stop me. [_laughs_]

speaker: Lorna
text: Not me! [_laughs and kisses him_] I wonder what time it is?

speaker: Frasier
text: Hm, well, [_looks at clock_] ten 'o clock.

speaker: Lorna
text: [_shouting and sitting up_] Oh crap, I'm late!

speaker: Frasier
text: Is there something I can do?

speaker: Lorna
text: Oh, yeah, make this lousy hangover go away.  Where the hell are those aspirins. [_empties content of handbag on bed_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, perhaps I should get you a glass of water for those.  Would you prefer sparkling or still?

speaker: Frasier
text: Or not, I see you're fine.

speaker: Lorna
text: Oh, I'm sorry, did you want to finish this?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, you're the guest.

speaker: Lorna
text: [_into phone:_] Yeah, it's me, I'm running late.  Move my ten- thirty to eleven thirty. [_shouts:_] Just move it to eleven thirty! [_starts to smoke_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I didn't realise you smoked?

speaker: Lorna
text: Oh, I'm always trying to quit but my weight just balloons up.  trust me, you don't want to see my ass when I'm off these things!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I hate to be a fusspot but I'd prefer...

speaker: Lorna
text: [_into phone:_] Yeah?  Well, who let the dog in?  Put your brother on! [_shouts:_] Put your brother on!  Put your brother on! [_to Frasier:_] Would you be a sweetie and make me some coffee?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_intimidated:_] Okay.

speaker: Lorna
text: [_into phone:_] You know that mess better be cleaned up by the time I get home.  Both of you!  Put your brother on!  Put your brother on! [_shouts:_] Put your brother on the phone!

speaker: Lorna
text: [_to Frasier:_] Oh, this is nice. _Frasier is not so sure and exits the bedroom.  End of Act One.  Act Two.  Scene One - Frasier's Apartment. Martin and Niles enter the apartment.  Niles is carrying cooking equipment._

speaker: Martin
text: I still don't understand why you have to do all the cooking. Why don't you just take Mel out for a nice meal?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, because through cooking I can truly express my feelings for her.  You know, the French have a saying...

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, okay, I was just making conversation until we got home. _They meet Frasier in the kitchen.  Martin exits to the kitchen as Frasier enters the main area._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, dad.  Hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: I could really use some help preparing this dish today, if you're not busy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh gosh, Niles, I've got a lot errands to run.  You know, why don't you ask Daphne?

speaker: Niles
text: [_after a pause_] Ah, all right.  Oh, oh, oh, how did things go with Lorna? Did you summon up the courage to ask her out?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh come on, Frasier, seize the moment.  Faint heart never won fair lady.  You know, the French have a saying...

speaker: Lorna
text: Hi, Niles.

speaker: Lorna
text: Come here.  I have some really great news. [_lights a cigarette_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Do tell.

speaker: Lorna
text: Well, I called my office, and after my eleven-thirty I'm free for the rest of the day.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, what are you planning on doing? _The elevator arrives.  An elderly woman is stood inside.  Lorna holds the lift._

speaker: Lorna
text: Being with you, silly. [_kisses him_]

speaker: Woman
text: Excuse me.

speaker: Lorna
text: [_shouts_] I'm coming! [_then:_] You know, you are the best thing that has happened to me in a long time. [_kisses him and the gets into the lift before kissing him again, she finally gets in:_] I'm in, you happy?! [_the doors close_] **AH, THERE'S THE RUB** _Scene Two - Frasier's Kitchen. Niles is hard at work on a dish.  Daphne is acting as his assistant._

speaker: Niles
text: Whisk. [_she hands it to him, he whisks_] Spoon. [_she hands it to him, he stirs_] Cheesecloth. [_she wipes his brow as he tastes before the oven pings_] Perfect timing.  Daphne, open the oven. [_she does as he places it into the oven_] Ready.

speaker: Daphne
text: Shall I close, Dr. Crane?

speaker: Niles
text: Please. [_she does_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Do you think it'll be all right?

speaker: Niles
text: It's out of our hands now, Daphne. _They fall about laughing as Daphne playfully hits him over the head with the oven gloves._

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you for your help.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, my pleasure.  I haven't had this much fun in the kitchen since your brother caught his tie in the pasta machine. [_laughs_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughs_] Oh, and the real fun's just beginning - clean-up.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, you silly sod, here, run it under some cold water, I'll fetch the aloe cream. [_he runs his fingers under the water_] Come here. [_begins to rub the cream in_] This'll help.

speaker: Niles
text: I can't believe I just did that.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I do that sort of thing all the time.  You must be careful, those pan handles get awfully hot.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh well, not anymore, it's got a protective coating of skin on it.

speaker: Daphne
text: Just give it a minute to absorb.

speaker: Niles
text: That'll be fine. [_she carries on_] I'm feeling better already.

speaker: Niles
text: Thanks, Daphne.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, what's up?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_nervous_] Nothing.  Why should anything be up?  Dr. Crane burnt his hand and I was tending to it, that's all.  Oh my, look at the time, I've got to run. [_she picks up the clock and then runs out_]

speaker: Martin
text: Burnt, huh?  Well, you might want to keep something cold on that. [_gets a beer from fridge_] Here, you can hold my beer for me while I watch the game. _Martin gives Niles the beer to hold and exits, leaving Niles to run through the recent event in his head.  Scene Three - Caf e Nervosa. Frasier is sat when Niles enters and sits with him. _

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Niles.  How are you?

speaker: Niles
text: Fine.  Although the oddest thing just happened.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that man on the corner's name is Pete.  If you give him a dollar his monkey won't make those rude gestures.

speaker: Niles
text: No, this is about Daphne.  I burned my hand while I was cooking and she began putting first aid cream on it and in a very tender way and then, em, dad came in and she jumped as if she felt guilty.  Is it possible Daphne has feelings for me?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_quickly_] No.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah well, as long as you've considered it from all angles!

speaker: Frasier
text: If she was tender it was because you burnt your hand, if she jumped it was because dad startled her.  Come on, Niles, can't you see what's really going on here?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, obviously I haven't a clue.  I thought that man's monkey was waving hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Your relationship with Mel is growing deeper.  Isn't it possible that your fear of commitment is driving your mind to throw up these imaginary road blocks?

speaker: Niles
text: You think so?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you do have a history with this.  Remember the day after you proposed to Maris?  You went that evening to the opera, you were convinced that Leontyne Price was winking at you the whole night.

speaker: Niles
text: I suppose there could be commitment issues here.  Cooking a meal for one's mate is a big first step.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, especially for you.  I mean Maris never let you cook for her.

speaker: Niles
text: That's true, the closest I ever got was re-stocking the pills in her bedside Lazy Susan.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, guys.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh hey, Roz.  Frasier, thank you.  It's a big help. [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: My pleasure, Niles.

speaker: Roz
text: Bye. [_sits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, I see the book club has moved on to "Wuthering Heights."  Well...

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, please tell me they made a movie out of this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Twice.

speaker: Roz
text: Amen! [_bags the book_] So how did your date with Lorna go? Did you get up enough nerve to ask her to dinner?

speaker: Frasier
text: To dinner and breakfast!  We spent the night together.

speaker: Roz
text: Whoa!  You went to bed with the prom queen?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I woke up with "Carrie!"  She smokes, she screams, she's uncouth, and I'm actually meeting her here to break it off.

speaker: Roz
text: So soon?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well...

speaker: Roz
text: With the way your love life's been going, you may want to squeeze a couple more dates out of it.  You know, nuts for the winter!

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, Roz, I could never do that sort of thing.  Whenever I know that I have no future with a woman, I end it, right then and there.  Especially a woman like Lorna, recently divorced and vulnerable...

speaker: Roz
text: You always take the high road.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, I like to think so.  You know, if there's one thing I've learned, my old high school wounds are not going to be healed by sleeping with the prom queen.

speaker: Roz
text: Tell me about it: prom queen, assistant principal.  You can't go home again! _Frasier looks shocked as Roz stands, who notices Lorna entering smoking a cigarette._

speaker: Roz
text: Good luck. [_exits_]

speaker: Lorna
text: [_sits_] How are you doing, babycakes? [_kisses him, breathing her cigarette breath into him_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sarcastic:_] Thank you.  Now, listen, Lorna about tomorrow night, em...

speaker: Lorna
text: Oh, I'm sorry, I know we have plans but I completely forgot. It's the retirement dinner for Coach Palet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Who?

speaker: Lorna
text: Our high school football coach.  I'd love it if you'd go with me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I have to be honest with you here...

speaker: Lorna
text: Oh, come on, it'll be fun.  The old gang'll be there.

speaker: Frasier
text: The old gang, you say.  You mean like Chip Clayton and Lad Lunkquist.

speaker: Lorna
text: Yeah, the whole crowd.  Imagine the looks on their faces when they see us walk in together.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, imagine.

speaker: Lorna
text: Oh, come on, say you'll be my date.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I wouldn't want to let down the coach.

speaker: Lorna
text: [_shouts back_] Yeah, a spoon'd be nice! _Frasier looks slightly nervous.  Scene Four - Frasier's High School Frasier and Lorna arrive.  They are just outside of the gym where the dinner is being held._

speaker: Lorna
text: Oh, everyone's inside already, we're a little late.

speaker: Frasier
text: I guess we'll just have to make a grand entrance, after you.

speaker: Lorna
text: I just have to check my makeup.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, why tamper with perfection?

speaker: Lorna
text: Oh, aren't you sweet?

speaker: Frasier
text: Shall we?

speaker: Lorna
text: Hello? [_shouts_] What now?  What?  What? [_hits phone then to Frasier:_] My phone's playing up, I'm sorry, just two seconds, sweetie. _Lorna goes off to the side as Frasier checks on the gym.  It sounds busy and Frasier looks excited._

speaker: Lorna
text: [_arrives back shouting into phone:_] No, you can't have a party!  Because I said so.  Put your brother on!  Put your brother on!  Put your brother on- [_aside to Frasier:_] just a second, sweetie- [_to phone:_] -the phone!  You know, do what you want, I'm on a date! [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you ready?

speaker: Lorna
text: Ooop, you know what, this hook keeps coming undone. [_Frasier fastens the back of her dress_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I just took a look inside there.  Everybody's here, even old Mr. "Most-Likely-To-Succeed," Chip Clayton.

speaker: Lorna
text: Chip Clayton's a moron!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you used to be rather fond of him back in school.

speaker: Lorna
text: Well, everybody's changed since high school.  Except you. Truly, you're still the same sweet, decent guy you always were.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you. [_thinks_]

speaker: Lorna
text: No I mean it, believe me, I've been with enough jerks and users to know the difference.  Let's go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lorna, I can't go in there with you.

speaker: Lorna
text: Why not?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, because I came here for the wrong reasons: so all the cool kids would see me with school's most popular girl and I let you believe that we had hopes for some sort of a future when I know in my heart that there is none.  Well, if you walk in there with me it would be as my trophy and I just can't do that to you, I'm so sorry.

speaker: Lorna
text: You expect me to walk into a room full of my ex-classmates by myself?  Like some pathetic divorcee who couldn't scare up a date for some old jock sendoff?  I don't think so!

speaker: Frasier
text: Lorna...

speaker: Lorna
text: You know, I thought you'd be a nice rebound fling, get my feet wet dating again.  You don't want that, that's fine. But I'll tell you what we are going to do: You're going to take my arm, you're going to escort me in that room, we're going to dance, make out like freshmen and leave with your hand on my ass, you got it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Shall we? _And so the two trophies walk into the room together.  End of Act Two._
